titles: A new delightful ballad called, Debauchery scared; or, The beggar wench turn'd into a devil, together with the pollicy of bumpkin; giving a peasant account of commical passages between a country gentleman, and a London beggar-wench. Tune of, Ladies of London. This may be printed, R.P.
publisher: Printed for J. Bissel at the Bible and Harp near the hospital-gate in West-smithfield.,
notes: Verse: "A country gentleman came up to Town ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Imperfect: stained, with slight loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
